## p. 2 (#8) ################################################

04191
. 325
1902
ESTABLISHED IN 1887.
THE PUBLISHERS CIRCULAR AND BOOKSELLERS' RECORD OF
BRITISH AND FOREIGN LITERATURE
is published by Messrs. SAMPSON Low & Co. Limited, every Saturday. Price Three-hallpence.
In addition to a Leading Article and Notes and Announcements of Literary Interest
it gives full particulars of all New Books published during the Week.
ANNUAL SUBSCRIPTION :
8s. 6d. post-free


## p. 3 (#9) ################################################

PREFATORY NOTE
This sixty-sixth yearly issue of the English Catalogue of Books comprises the
titles of works published during 1902, also of some received too late for inclusion
in the sixty-fifth issue.
As bas been the case since 1891, titles and index are in one alphabet. The
main entry of each work begins with the author's surname (if given on the title page)
in heavy type. As an index to these • Author' records, the title, commencing with
its most important word or with its first word, is repeated in the same alphabet,
with that word in italics, which in the main entry is in thick type.
The . Transactions' of Learned Societies are recorded in an Appendix, as also
the Series' and · Libraries' issued by some publisbers.
The names and addresses of the publishers of Great Britain and Ireland will be
found at the end of the volume, followed by those of the principal publishers in the
United States and in Canada. The telegraph and cable addresses and telephone
numbers have now, for the first time, been added when known.
Hearty thanks are due to many publishers, secretaries, authors, and biblio.
graphers who have assisted in making this book more correct and comprehensive than
it otherwise would have been.
The Editor will be glad to have particulars of author, price, publisher, and month
of publication of any work which may have been omitted ; they should be
addressed to
The Editor of Tbe Englisb Catalogue, .
St. Dunstan's House,
Fetter Lane,
E.C.
January 31, 1903.

given where possible in inches, 1 inch = 23 centimetres.

[1902
THE ENGLISH CATALOGUE
DIRECTORY OF PUBLISHERS
All the Publishers have been invited by post to send us their Telegraphic Address and Telephone Number.
Those sent will be found below between square brackets [ ], and separated from each other by a
semicolon (;).
This list of Publishers, with their Addresses, has been principally compiled with a view to supplying informa.
tion regarding the books in the 1903 English Catalogue. This will explain the inclusion of many firms in the
list who can scarcely, in the strict acceptation of the term, be called Publishers, since the publication of books
forms only an occasional portion of their business.
